description.narrative: Communication, Advocacy and Partnership, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Communications/External relations

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnerships for social and behaviour change
Children, adolescent and youth engagement and participation
Research, monitoring, evaluation and knowledge management for SBC
Technical assistance - Cross-sectoral social and behaviour change

title.narrative: UNICEF Programmes in Chile (Communication and mobilization)
UNICEF Programmes in Chile (Crisis and Emergencies)
Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals
Interagency Humanitarian Response Assessments and Plans

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

description.narrative: UNICEF continued strengthening the alliances started in previous years and added new ones to meet the objectives of the CPD. UNICEF, together with its partners, reinforced its advocacy especially on the issues of returning to school, vaccinations, child poverty and adolescent participation within the framework of the elaboration of the new Political Constitution of the country. New alliances were forged to contribute to future issues such as climate change with the Ministry of Energy; risks and benefits of using social networks with private companies; as well as to address problems that are occurring in the country such as migration. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:19/01/2022
